level.heading: REFUSAL TO ISSUE OR ALTER CERTIFICATES OF TITLE AND SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OFERTIFICATES OF TITLE (ยง 18-410)

level.text: If the Director determines that an applicant for a certificate of title is not entitled to the certificate, or that a person who requests that a certificate be officially altered is not entitled to that alteration, the Director shall refuse to issue the certificate or make the alteration.
The Director may, after notice and hearing, suspend or revoke a certificate issued erroneously, issued as the result of fraud or misrepresentation, or for which the prescribed fee was not paid.

Any order of refusal, suspension, or revocation shall set forth the proposed action and the grounds thereof in sufficient detail to allow the person adversely affected by the order to understand fully the nature of the order and the reasons for issuance.
Any person whose certificate has been refused, suspended, or revoked by the Director may petition for a hearing subject to the provisions of chapter 10.
